channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Los Angeles’s Democrat mayor wants to axe 1,600 employees as city flounders in slumping economy and wildfire damage
item.description: The prospect of chopping hundreds of government jobs comes as the latest unwelcome news for the first-term Democrat, who will stand for reelection nex...

item.title: Global markets are all over the place after U.S. stocks slump following Trump’s attacks on Fed chair Powell
item.description: Analysts expressed a high degree of nervousness at the prospect that Powell might be replaced by someone who would give Trump more direct political co...

item.title: Karen Read Retrial Set to Begin Opening Arguments
item.description: Ms. Read is accused of intentionally backing a vehicle into her boyfriend, a Boston police officer, and killing him in 2022. Her first trial last year...

item.title: LA lawsuits accuse insurance companies of colluding to ‘suddenly and simultaneously’ drop coverage in fire-prone parts of California

item.title: Gold Price Sets Another Record as Trump’s Tariffs Unnerve Markets

item.title: Education Department Will Resume Collections on Student Loan Debt

item.title: How to Choose a Pope, and a Deportation ‘Black Hole’
item.description: Plus, the Oscars OK the use of A.I. (with caveats).

item.title: Georgia Gov. Kemp signs 2 laws aimed at cutting jury awards and limiting when businesses and property owners can be held liable for negligence
item.description: Opponents of the new law note verdicts in the millions of dollars are rare, and those over $10 million represent less than 1% of outcomes.

item.title: Europe’s richest man Bernard Arnault slammed the EU for failing U.S. negotiations—but von der Leyen says countries are ‘lining up to work with us’
item.description: "It will be Brussels' fault" if LVMH produces more of its high-end goods in the U.S., Arnault warned.

item.title: Nations have begun official periods of mourning.

item.title: In Caracas, remembering a pastor ‘who walked with his flock until his final day.’

item.title: China says it is willing to keep improving ties with the Vatican.
